assertions.title: Certificate-based authentication is configured for API server
assertions.rationale: Certificate-based authentication provides strong identity verification for API server access.

assertions.title: Service account token authentication is securely configured
assertions.rationale: Secure token authentication prevents unauthorized service account access.

assertions.title: OpenID Connect integration is enabled for external identity providers
assertions.rationale: OIDC integration enables centralized identity management and single sign-on.

assertions.title: RBAC authorization mode is enabled on API server
assertions.rationale: RBAC provides fine-grained access control for Kubernetes resources.

assertions.title: Admission controllers are enabled for authorization decisions
assertions.rationale: Admission controllers enforce policies at API request time.

assertions.title: RBAC policies enforce least privilege access
assertions.rationale: Least privilege RBAC policies minimize attack surface and prevent privilege escalation.

assertions.title: Cluster-admin role bindings are restricted and audited
assertions.rationale: Restricting cluster-admin access prevents unauthorized cluster-wide privilege escalation.

assertions.title: Wildcard (*) permissions are prohibited in RBAC policies
assertions.rationale: Wildcard permissions violate least privilege and create excessive access rights.

assertions.title: Service account token auto-mounting is disabled where not required
assertions.rationale: Disabling unnecessary token auto-mounting reduces attack surface and prevents credential exposure.

assertions.title: Pods use unique service accounts instead of default
assertions.rationale: Unique service accounts enable proper access control and audit trails.

assertions.title: Service account token rotation is enabled
assertions.rationale: Token rotation limits the impact of compromised credentials.

assertions.title: Service account token usage is audited
assertions.rationale: Token audit trails enable detection of unauthorized access and credential abuse.

assertions.title: User impersonation capabilities are restricted
assertions.rationale: Restricting impersonation prevents unauthorized privilege escalation and maintains audit integrity.

assertions.title: Pod Security Admission (PSA) is enforced at namespace level
assertions.rationale: PSA enforcement ensures consistent pod security standards across namespaces.

assertions.title: Pod Security Policies are enabled and configured
assertions.rationale: Pod Security Policies enforce security constraints on pod specifications.

assertions.title: Privilege escalation is disabled in pod specifications
assertions.rationale: Disabling privilege escalation prevents containers from gaining additional privileges.

assertions.title: Privileged containers are prohibited
assertions.rationale: Privileged containers have unrestricted access to host resources and increase attack surface.

assertions.title: Containers are configured to run as non-root user
assertions.rationale: Running as non-root reduces the impact of container compromise.

assertions.title: Container root filesystem is read-only
assertions.rationale: Read-only root filesystem prevents malicious code from persisting or modifying system files.

assertions.title: Dangerous Linux capabilities are dropped
assertions.rationale: Dropping dangerous capabilities limits container privileges and attack surface.

assertions.title: NET_RAW capability is dropped
assertions.rationale: NET_RAW capability allows packet crafting and network attacks.

assertions.title: Seccomp profiles are enforced on containers
assertions.rationale: Seccomp profiles restrict system calls and limit container capabilities.

assertions.title: AppArmor profiles are enforced on containers
assertions.rationale: AppArmor profiles restrict application behavior and file access.

assertions.title: Host network namespace sharing is disabled
assertions.rationale: Host network access bypasses network policies and exposes container traffic.

assertions.title: Host PID namespace sharing is disabled
assertions.rationale: Host PID namespace sharing allows access to host processes and increases attack surface.

assertions.title: Host path volume mounts are restricted
assertions.rationale: Host path mounts can expose sensitive host files and directories.

assertions.title: Network policies enforce namespace isolation
assertions.rationale: Network policies prevent lateral movement and enforce micro-segmentation.

assertions.title: Egress traffic is controlled by network policies
assertions.rationale: Egress controls prevent data exfiltration and unauthorized external communication.

assertions.title: TLS termination is enabled on ingress resources
assertions.rationale: TLS termination encrypts traffic between clients and ingress controllers.

assertions.title: Ingress controller is configured with security best practices
assertions.rationale: Secure ingress controller configuration prevents common web attacks.

assertions.title: Mutual TLS is enabled in service mesh
assertions.rationale: mTLS provides service-to-service authentication and encryption.

assertions.title: DNS policies are enforced for pod resolution
assertions.rationale: DNS policies control name resolution and prevent DNS-based attacks.

assertions.title: etcd encryption at rest is enabled
assertions.rationale: etcd encryption protects sensitive data stored in the cluster state.

assertions.title: Kubernetes secrets are encrypted at rest
assertions.rationale: Secret encryption prevents unauthorized access to sensitive configuration data.

assertions.title: RBAC is configured for secret access
assertions.rationale: Secret RBAC controls prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data.

assertions.title: External secret management is integrated
assertions.rationale: External secret management provides centralized, secure secret lifecycle management.

assertions.title: ConfigMaps do not contain sensitive data

assertions.title: API server audit logging is enabled
assertions.rationale: API server audit logs provide security event tracking and compliance evidence.

assertions.title: Anonymous access to API server is disabled

assertions.title: etcd peer communication uses TLS

assertions.title: etcd client communication uses TLS
